El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Inés es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa de su madre, que trabaja en el mismo rubro, posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las comunidades tropicales del Departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Flores de Libertad” (Flowers of Freedom) communal bank will start the seventh cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Inés.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, fruit sales, blanket weaving, neighborhood store, sweatshirt making, sweater sewing and peas and lima bean sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Inés.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for 8 cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s promoters that visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling fruit.  She relates that she started the business on her mother’s initiative who is in the same line of work and she decided later on to set up her own business space.

The loan she’ll take out now es to increase capital.  She will buy fruit in the tropical communities in La Paz Department and then sell it in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home as possible since she’s single and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 67 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia junta su esposa.  Walter se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de desechos de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Se inicio hace más de 30 años, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos en la preparación y venta del carbón.Decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a sus hijos, logrando sacarlos adelante brindándoles su educación siendo su mayor orgullo.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, se siente agradecido con el crédito recibido para continuar con su negocio y desea seguir contando con más créditos.  Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto  de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbones.
texts.en:
Walter, 67, is married living in his own house with his wife.  Walter works making and selling charcoal made from left-over wood from nearby sawmills.  He started over 30 years ago and to date does it with help from his children who help him make and sell the charcoal.  He decided to start this activity because he needed to have a source of income to support his children.  He succeeded in doing so and provided them with an education which is his greatest source of pride.

Seeing the good results he’s getting and the good profits he nets, therefore, he wants to continue with his business and to maintain it because it’s his only source of support.

This is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the loan he’ll get to continue with his business and he wants to continue relying on more loans.  Because of this he commits to be punctual with his payments.

He will use the 500 new soles to buy the main raw material needed to make the charcoal.

loans.use: to buy wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha is 42 years old and married. She has seven children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane, among other business activities, in the Philippines. She has been cultivating sugarcane for 20 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling livestock, and food vending.

Alpha is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting an additional loan. She wants to further build her farming sugarcane, food vending and livestock businesses. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers, and other supplies for cultivating sugarcane

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children who are in school, Connie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and restaurant businesses. 

Connie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, oil, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Connie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, oil, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Dioleta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine. Dioleta is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Dioleta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María, a sus 52 años de edad es una mujer soltera y madre de un hijo. Durante más de 28 años laboró en diferentes empresas y obtuvo así los ingresos necesarios para sacar adelante a su hijo y brindarle educación, pero hace 7 años se quedó sin empleo y depende económicamente de sus familiares y su hijo. Ella vive con su padre, ya que su único hijo  de 34 años de edad vive fuera del país, pero manifiesta que no se siente bien siendo una carga para otras personas. María es una mujer muy dinámica y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y obtener los ingresos para su hogar por su propia cuenta, por eso se motiva para solicitar un crédito ya que desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de helados y mecato, desea invertirlo en la compra de un congelador, adecuar su casa con una reja y comprar surtido (mecato, gaseosas, helados) para aprovechar que en la zona donde vive hay muchos niños y no existe un negocio que ofrezca los productos, así podrá generar ingresos para sostener a su padre y llevar el alimento a su hogar. María sueña con tener su negocio bien posicionado y que perdure en el tiempo, y poco a poco poder introducir más variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, who is 52 years old, is a single woman and has a son. She worked for different companies for over 28 years, which is how she obtaind the income she needed to provide for her son and give him an education. But seven years ago she became unemployed and depends financially on her relatives and her son. She lives with her father, since her only son, who is 34 years old, lives abroad. But she says that she doesn't feel good about being a burden for other people. 

María is a very dynamic woman and she is very eager to get ahead and bring home an income on her own. That is her motivation to request a loan, because she wants to start her own business selling ice cream and snacks. She wants to invest in purchasing a freezer, install bars in her home, and stock up on products (snacks, sodas, ice cream). This will make the most of the fact that in the area where she lives there are a lot of children and no businesses that offer these products. This will allow her to generate income to support her father and bring sustenance to her home. 

María's dream is to have a well-established and long-standing business. She would like to gradually introduce a wider variety of products in order to satisfy her customers' needs so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to start her business, buy a freezer, install bars in her home, and buy products (snacks, sodas, ice cream).

loans.name: Perlas Doradas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLAS DORADAS”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: consultorio dental, costura de billeteras, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de coca, alquiler de vajillas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de billeteras; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás cuando aprendió la técnica de costura de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Perlas Doradas” (Golden Pearls) communal bank will start the fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Angélica.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: dental office, wallet making, vegetable sales, neighborhood store, coca leaf sales and chinaware rental.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Angélica.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for four cycles having joined thanks to an invitation by one of the institution’s promoters that visited her at home.  She currently has a business making wallets.  She says she learned this business years ago when she learned the sewing technique for these products.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy leather at wholesale in stores in El Alto and after making them will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family the best way possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 30 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Verónica se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de trozos de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Se inicio hace más de 06 años, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos en la preparación y venta del carbón.Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que les deja, así como la demanda que le permite vender todos su producción.
Se decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a su familia.Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento.Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbones.
texts.en:
Verónica, 30, is married living in her own house with her husband and three children.  Verónica works making and selling charcoal she makes from lengths of lumber from local sawmills.  She started more than six years ago and to date does so with help from her children who help her make and sell the charcoal.  She considers her business to be profitable because of the good profits she nets as well as the demand that makes it possible for her to sell her entire production.

She decided to start this activity because she needed to have a source of income to support her family.  Therefore, seeing the good results she’s having and the profits she nets she wants to continue with her business and maintain it since it’s her only source of support.  

This will be her first Kiva loan so she’s relying on your collaboration to continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she commits to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the 500 new soles to buy the main raw material to manufacture the charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal-making raw materials.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 30 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Maria se dedica al cultivo de Yucas, para eso cuenta con su propio terreno de 10 hectáreas, la cual está en crecimiento y una vez listo, los vende a los comerciantes de los mercados más cercanos de la localidad. 
Se inició con su propio capital, sembrando 1 hectárea y luego fue ampliando a más, viendo la demanda que tiene. Aprendió éste negocio de su padre. Comenta que se inició en éste negocio por el deseo de ser una empresaria y contar con sus propios ingresos. Logrando tener buenos resultados, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y ampliar las extensiones de sembrío de yuca, así generarse más ingresos y atender otros mercados. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Se siente contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Por tanto, se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en abono orgánico para ampliar su capacidad de producción y poder atender la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old, married and lives in her own house with her husband and 5 children. Maria works in yuca cultivation, for which she has her own 10 hectares of land she is currently growing on. Once they are ready, she will sell it to the vendors in the closest markets.

She got started by planting 1 hectare using her own capital. Later she expanded, seeing the demand for it. She learned this trade from her father. She says she got started in this trade because she wanted to be a business owner with her own income. Having achieved good results, she now has plans to continue with her business, expanding her yuca planting areas. This will allow her to generate a higher income for herself and serve other markets.

This will be her first loan with Kiva. She is glad to know that she will have the financial support to go ahead with her plans and promises to be responsible with her payments. She will invest the sum of 800 nuevos soles in organic fertilizer to expand her production capacity and be able to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to expand her yuca production.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es: La Sra. Gumercinda sigue con la misma actividad de la Venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en el mantenimiento de su vehículo,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Gumercinda continues with her food sales activity.  She relates that she did well with the previous loan that she used to service her vehicle.  On this occasion she requests the loan to buy ingredients to make her meals.  She feels happy and grateful for the business growth opportunity she’s being given..

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Chiradee Lian

texts.en:
Chiradee Lian is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income by selling pre-paid mobile load, and raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store, like sugar, rice, and oil.

Chiradee Lian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store, like sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Fanny is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries during harvesting and buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for the next plantation.

Fanny has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries during harvesting and buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for the next plantation.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Francisca works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a cafeteria. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her restaurant and cafeteria business. Francisca is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 33 years old and married with two children.

Jenny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like sugar, oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Jenny has borrowed and paid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Jenny aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like sugar, oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business, buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years, and she earns additional income by growing peanuts.

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and married with three children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar and noodles to sell.

Violeta has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for six years and also earns income from a motorcycle transport business.

Violeta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar and noodles to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma works hard to support her family. Erma is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Erma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Erma has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Erma would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to puchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 52 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets and feed.

Elisa has been raising pigs for 20 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Marilita

texts.en:
Marilita works hard to support her family. Marilita is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Marilita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Marilita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Marilita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Riccy Miriams

texts.es:
Riccy tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Riccy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos. 

Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas, además alimento para los cerdos como polvillo. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Riccy, 40, is in a common law relationship and has two children; she lives with her husband and children in Recinto Mina de Piedra belonging to Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She belongs to the “30 de Noviembre” (November 30) communal bank located in Recinto Mina de Piedra belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Riccy works in agriculture growing corn and raising pigs.  She will be able to buy supplies like fertilizer, manure and seeds as well as pig feed like ‘polvillo’ [rice bran] with the loan.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  Her dream is to buy land to work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pig feed.

loans.name: Nury Elena

texts.es: Elena es una mujer casada y no tiene hijos, a sus 43 años de edad se dedica hace 6 años a la fabricación de productos en arte country, actividad que aprendió en un grupo de madres comunitarias al que asistía; de esta forma adquiere los ingresos para apoyar la carga económica en su hogar. Actualmente trabaja sola, pero quisiera poder emplear una persona para que la apoye en el proceso inicial de pulir la madera. Elena se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, organizada y muy activa, siempre va en busca de oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante, por esa razón solicita el primer ciclo de crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de un compresor y materia prima al por mayor (madera MDF), con el fin de poder tener los insumos necesarios para cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y darle una terminación perfecta a sus productos, así podrá vender más y generar más recursos para cumplir uno de sus principales sueños en un futuro cercano, que es montar su negocio en un local propio y dar clases sobre este arte a otras personas, lo que le generará ingresos adicionales y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elena is 43 years old and is married with no children. For the last 6 years she has been making "country art" crafts, having learnt the skill at a community mothers' group which she attended. Through this she earns an income which helps towards the household expenses. Currently she is working alone but she would like to be able to employ someone to help her in the initial process of polishing the wood. 

Elena is enterprising, organised and very active and she always looks for opportunities which enable her to improve her life. This is why she is asking for her first loan with the intention of buying a compressor and buying raw material (MDF wood) wholesale. This will give her the necessary supplies to meet her customers' requirements and give her products a perfect finish. In this way she will be able to sell more and generate more funds to be able to fulfil one of her main dreams for the near future, which is to set up her business in a place of her own and give classes in this art form to other people. This will give her an additional income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and raw material wholesale (MDF wood)

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice, in the Philippines. She earns additional income from prepared food vending. 

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nilda works hard to support her family. She has a prepared food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

Nilda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business. Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Leila

texts.es:
Leila tiene 50 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto solo su esposo, ya que sus 3 hijos están independientes. Leila se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde una tienda instalada en su propia casa.  Lleva más de 06 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ocasionalmente, quienes atienden cuando  está fuera de casa. Considera a su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la regular demanda que tiene desde que se inició en su negocio. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y se siente ocupada. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio,  ampliarlo vendiendo bebidas gaseosas y ropas. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. 
Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías  como arroz y azúcar para su tienda, así también bebidas gaseosas y ropas.
texts.en:
Leila, 50, is married living in her own house with just her husband since their three children are independent.  Leila works selling foodstuffs in a store she has at home.  She’s been doing this for more than six years and to date her husband helps her occasionally when she’s away from home.  

She considers her business to be profitable because of the profits she nets and because of the steady demand she’s had ever since she opened the store.  She likes her business because it generates income and she keeps occupied.  Therefore, she wants to continue growing in her business and to expand into clothing and soft-drink sales.  

This will be her first Kiva loan.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because now she’ll feel more sure of advancing with her business.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to buy merchandise like rice and sugar as well as soft-drinks and clothes for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Crispula

texts.en:
Crispula is 62 years old and married with eight children.

Crispula works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, milk, canned goods and sugar for her store.

Crispula has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending and selling pre-paid mobile loads.

Crispula aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, milk, canned goods and sugar for her store

loans.name: Potenciana

texts.en:
Potenciana is 45 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Potenciana works very hard to provide for her family.
 
Potenciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks.

Potenciana has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Potenciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Betty works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Betty is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, cooking oil, milk and sugar for her general store business.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, cooking oil, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Joffre Jose

texts.es:
Joffre tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil Soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Joffre se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos esta empezando a trabajar. 

El credito lo solicita para invertir en: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas, además balanceado y cereales para los animales. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Joffre is 37 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives with his parents in the Mina de Piedra precinct, which is in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

He belongs to the "30 de Noviembre" (November 30th) solidarity group, which is located in the Mina de Piedra precinct in the Ventanas canton.

He works in agriculture and livestock. Joffree makes a living by growing corn and raising farm animals like chickens, and he is beginning to work with pigs.

He will invest the loan in: fertilizers, manure, and seeds, as well as food and grain for his animals. He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to buy land to continue to work.

loans.use: fertilizer, manure, and seeds, as well as food and grain for his animals.

loans.name: Leonor Margarita

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 38 años de edad de estado civil Unida tiene dos hijos vive el espeso y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Leonor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos.

El credito lo solicita para invertir en: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas, además balanceado y cereales para los animales. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener dinero para viajar a la playa con la familia.
texts.en:
Leonor is 38 years old, in a relationship, and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in the Mina de Piedra precinct, which is in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

She belongs to the "30 de Noviembre" (November 30th) solidarity group, which is located in the Mina de Piedra precinct in the Ventanas canton. Its members make a living working in agriculture and raising livestock.

Leonor works in agriculture, growing corn and raising farm animals like chickens and pigs.

She will invest this loan in: fertilizer, manure, and seeds, and also food and grain for her animals. She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to have enough money to go to the beach with her family.

loans.use: fertilizer, manure, and seeds, and also food and grain for her animals.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old married man who lives in a small house with his wife in Qalqilia city. Mahmoud is a worker whose low income is not enough to cover the family's needs. Mahmoud lives in an old house in poor condition. He would like to repair his house so he and his wife can improve their living conditions. 
Mahmoud requested a USD $1,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay to repair his home by painting and installing windows and doors. Mahmoud will be able to improve his home and live in better conditions with his wife. 
This photo of Mahmoud was taken in his house.

loans.use: to pay for repairing his home, especially painting and installing windows and doors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pots.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: El Sr. Saturnino  tiene 49 años, casada con un hijo, el se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Pantini, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Saturnino  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Saturnino  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz, El Sr. Saturnino en la foto se encuentra en compañia de su Sra. Esposa.
texts.en:
Saturnino, 49, is married with a son; he works making and selling cheese and milk since he owns dairy cattle.  He lives in Pantini and people there work in agriculture and raising cattle.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Saturnino will use the loan to buy a dairy cow; he wants to take advantage of this opportunity.

His reason for requesting the loan is that he does not have money for the purchase that will be of great benefit because it will provide a great amount of milk so he can produce more cheese and milk and improve his income.

The business challenge Saturnino faces is having to buy forage every so often.  He will use profits to improve his cattle and his wish is to be able to make cheese at wholesale and to sell it to various markets in the city of La Paz.  

Saturnino appears in the photo in the company of his wife.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat, 63, is married with seven children. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Sangke district. The main source of her family’s income is from selling grocery items in the village. She has been running her business for four years, earning about KHR 35,000 per day, and she is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day.

Nat received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, seven cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. With a good business, she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is aged 49 years and married. She lives with her husband and six in a rural area located in the Cheuny Prey district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer on two hectares of farmland, and she has been in this business for 29 years. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day to feed the family, and she manages to save about 6,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Yon with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR. She will use this amount to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Fernando Lenin

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 29 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos vive los padres en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Fernando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para construir una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Fernando, 29, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents in Recinto Mina de Piedra belonging to Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He belongs to the “30 de Noviembre” (November 30) communal bank located in Recinto Mina de Piedra belonging to Ventanas Canton; it works in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Fernando works in agriculture growing corn and raising barnyard animals like chickens and pigs.  He will be able to use the loan to buy supplies like fertilizer and insecticide to avoid pests and also nutritionally balanced animal feed.  His purchases take place in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to buy a lot to build a house and in his free time he enjoys going out walking.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Danis Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Danis Rafael de 30 de edad  es casado, tiene dos hijos  que dependen de él, sus hijos tiene edades de 05 y 03 años, vive en una comunidad de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Don Danis vive en casa de sus suegros  y se dedica desde hace 03  años  a la venta de dulces y galletas por mayor y al detalle,  las distribuye en pulperías y  a personas que se dedican a este tipo de negocio.
Don Danis es una persona trabajadora que se levanta temprano a vender sus productos en su motocicleta.
Don Danis está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de confites, bombones, galletas, chocolates, etc.  Ya que quiere ampliar el negocio y surtir una glorieta que está en la escuela de su comunidad, con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos, está muy agradecido con Prisma por el apoyo a su negocio.
Don Danis su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio  del 2013
texts.en:
Danis Rafael, 30, is married with two children who depend on him; his children are 5 and 3 years of age.   He lives in a community in Choluteca in south Honduras.  Danis lives in his in-laws’ house and for the last three years has been working selling candy and cookies at wholesale and retail.  He sells them to grocery stores and to people who are in this type of business.  Danis is a hardworking man who rises early to sell his goods on his motorcycle.

Danis is requesting the loan to buy sweets, bonbons, cookies, chocolates, etc. because he wants to expand the business and stock a stand near a school in his community.  With the loan’s help he intends to improve his income.  He’s very grateful to Prisma for the support for his business.  His dream is to have a house of his own.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2013

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 51 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Arsenia buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Arsenia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Arsenia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gomersenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gomersenda works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from soap making. Gomersenda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Gomersenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim is aged 25 and married. She has two children. Living in a village of the Moung Russey district, Kim farms rice. Having been in this business for three years, she manages to earn about 6,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children.

Kim’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle, and they completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.en:
Saly, 58, is from a rural village located in the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is widowed with seven children, one of whom is still in school. She earns a living through farming rice. She has been in this business for 30 years. The current business earns her family about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Saly has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of five to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.  

She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es:
Estefita tiene 34, está casada y vive en la casa de su suegra junta su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Estefita se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de desperdicios  de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Se inicio hace más de 02 años, con bastante esfuerzo, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su padre en la preparación y venta del carbón. Se decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a su familia, brindándoles su educación a sus hijos ya que son su mayor orgullo. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, por ello cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto de 600 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para sus carbones que son los desechos de madera.
texts.en: Estefita, 34, is married living in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband and three children.  Estefita works making and selling charcoal made from left over lumber from nearby sawmills.  She started two years ago with much effort and to date works with help from her father with charcoal production and sales.  She decided to start her activity because she needed to have a source of income to support her family to provide an education for her children who are her greatest source of pride.  Therefore, seeing the good results and profits she gets she wants to continue with her business and maintain it since it’s her only source of income.  This is her first Kiva loan so she’s counting on your collaboration to continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she commits to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the 600 new soles to buy her main raw material, waste lumber, for her charcoal.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making charcoal.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos. 
Doris se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de desechos de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Se inicio hace más de 04  años, hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su esposo en la preparación y venta del carbón.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que les deja, así como la demanda que le permite vender todos su producción.
Decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener a su familia, logrando sacarlos adelante brindándoles su educación siendo su mayor orgullo.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio.
Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, agradece a quienes hicieron posible su crédito. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbones que son los desechos de madera.
texts.en:
Doris, 30, is married living in her own house with her husband and two children.  She works making and selling charcoal made from waste lumber from nearby sawmills.  She started more than four years ago and to date works with her husband’s help making and selling charcoal.

She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the profits it nets as well as the demand that allows her to sell her entire production.  She decided to start this activity because she needed a source of income to support her family.  She succeeded in providing them with an education and this is her greatest source of pride.

Therefore, seeing the good results and profits she gets, she wants to continue with her business.  This will be her first Kiva loan and she is grateful to all those who made her loan possible.  On the other hand she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to buy the main raw material for making charcoal, waste lumber.

loans.use: to buy charcoal-making raw materials.

loans.name: Viloroco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILOROCO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de leche, venta de ganado y queso, trenzado de mantas, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por consejo de su familia ya que desde niña sus padres realizaban este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de vaca lechera) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza elaborara los productos para su comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Viloroco" communal bank is requesting their first loan from Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana Regional Office. The group includes 8 members and is run by a governing board, of which Virginia is the president. The members of the communal bank have various businesses, including milk production, cattle and cheese sales, braiding blankets, and weaving blankets.

The loan that they have requested will benefit small business owners, one of whom is Virginia. She states that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, and that she joined due to the invitation of a promoter of the institution who visited her at her house. She currently has a business in which she makes and sells cheese. She reports that she began this business due to her family's advice, since her parents have worked in this business since she was young.
 
The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her merchandise (buy a dairy cow) that she will obtain from the neighboring community and later  raise the cow and make products to sell. This job allows her to generate the resources to maintain her family, since she is not married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Leonila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 48-year-old married man from Qalqilia. He is a father of a son and a daughter who are studying in the university. Ali is a worker in a local factory and his low income is not enough to cover the family's needs. Ali lives in an old house in poor condition. He would like to move into a new house so he and his family will live in better conditions. 
Ali requested a USD $2,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay to complete his new house, especially painting and some decorating. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to finish his house as soon as possible and move into it. 
In the photo, Ali appears in his unfinished house.

loans.use: to pay to complete his new home especially painting and some decorating.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, 46, lives with his wife and five children in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. Out of his five children, three are still in school. To feed the family, Chan is a motor-taxi driver while his wife grows oranges on their farm to earn extra income for the family. Having been in these businesses for 10 years, they can earn about 46,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Chan has been with VisionFund for six loans and completely repaid the past loans which have helped better support his business. Now, he is leading his group of two to ask for a new loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm. Chan hopes to increase his crop yields so as to generate more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Luza Group

texts.en:
This group is called Luza, and it is comprised of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Zahra is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She is an entrepreneur, and she has been sewing shoes for five years.  She is totally dependent on the income from this business, to feed her family and to cover their living expenses.

She took a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. Her purpose in taking the loan was to purchase an industrial sewing machine for making shoes. This loan will help her to meet the demand of her clients. She hopes to improve her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine, for making shoes.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Residing in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Phan is 51 years old and is married with six children. She earns a living through farming rice and corn in the local area. Having been in these businesses for 20 years, Phan is able to earn about KHR 27,000 per day, and she manages to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Phan has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She fully repaid the past loan, which has enabled her family to have enough food. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her plantation so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Antonia Magdalena

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Desde un inicio, la mamá del cliente se dedicaba al negocio de la producción de jabón prieto, la cual ha pasado por algunas generaciones.  De ahí en adelante, ha emprendido en esta actividad que le ha resultado bastante productiva.  Ella empieza a trabajar desde las 6 am hasta las 5 pm, con su esposo e hijos que la ayudan cosntantemente.  Mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene 10 hijos, de los cuales 4 viven con ella.  Desea invertir el préstamo en materia prima para su negocio, como piñón, leña y legía.
texts.en: The client is from Portoviejo.  At the beginning her mother worked making 'jabón pireto' [natural soap] which had passed down through several generations.  From then on she’s been in this same activity and it’s been quite productive.  She starts work at 6am and goes until 5pm with constant help from her husband and children.  She’s in a common law relationship and has ten children four of which live with her.  She wants to use the loan to buy raw materials like pine nuts, firewood and lye.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Santos' Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LUNA LUNITA,  Está  compuesto por trece integrantes Diez mujeres y tres varones,   el presidente del banco es el Sr. Santos tiene 57 años y seis hijos  que ya son mayores de edad,  su actividad económica es venta frutas según a la temporada, el se dedica a esta actividad hace 20 años, el destino del crédito es para la compra fruta de la temporada por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta, el Sr. Santos es una persona trabajadora, ya que esta es única fuente de ingresos, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado, el tiene su puesto de venta en la zona de Bolívar en uno de los mercados de la zona, el deseo de el Sr. Santos es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos como también incrementar su clientela para generar mayores ingresos económicos, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “Luna Lunita” (Moon Little Moon) communal bank consists of 13 members, ten women and three men.  The bank president is Santos who is 57-years-old and has six children who are all adults now.  His economic activity is selling seasonal fruit, an activity he’s been in for 20 years.  

The loan is earmarked for the purchase of seasonal fruit at wholesale for his stand.  Santos is a hardworking man since this is his only source of income.  He feels grateful to the institution for the support provided.  

His sales stand is in the Bolívar zone in one of the zone’s markets.  Santos’ wish is to have a store where he can offer a variety of products while increasing his clientele to generate higher income.  He feels happy and grateful with the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan is a 34-year-old woman, who lives in a rural village of the Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been growing cassava for 15 years. The current business earns her about 33,000 KHR per day.

Nan has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and successfully repaid her previous loans. Now she is applying for another loan, in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR, from VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to reap a greater crop yield, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin is 45 years old and has four children. Currently, her one child is still in school and relies on her. She earns a living though rice farming on five hectares of her farmland which she has been doing for 27 years. This is fourth cycles for Sarin with VisionFund, and she has successfully paid back the past loan. She feels confident that she can improve her living condition so she leads a group of two members to take a new loan. She and her one group member are seeking a loan of 4,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farming. She hopes to make more income so that she can better her lifestyle and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farming

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en: Thoeurn is a 47-year-old father of two children who lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He is a rice farmer who has worked in the rainy season field on eight hectares on his farmland for 25 years. The current business has a return of about 30,500 KHR per day. This is his fourth loan with VisionFund with the others fully repaid. Thoeurn and his two group members requested a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, he will use his loan portion to buy fertilizers for rice growing. With this loan, he hopes to increase his crop yields from rice farming, earn more income, and have more savings and a better living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice farming

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija de 23 años de edad, posee una tienda donde vende aceite, golosinas, refrescos, salsa de tomate, sopas, azúcar, arroz, etc. tiene mucha clientela porque tiene la tienda muy surtida y con lo que los clientes necesitan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña lorenza esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz y frijol por quintal ya que ha tenido mucha demanda con esos granos básico, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder comprarlos, por eso solicita dicho crédito y así podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y ella tendrá mejores ganancias par tener una mejor calidad de vida con su hija.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 62, lives in her own house with her 23-year-old daughter.  She owns a store where she sells oil, snacks, soft-drinks, tomato sauce, soups, sugar, rice, etc.  She has many customers because the store is well-stocked with what customers need.  She manages to cover some of her household expenses with profits earned.  

Lorenza is asking for a loan to buy corn and beans by the quintal because these basic grains are in high demand but she’s unable to buy them with what she earns and this is why she’s requesting said loan to be able to provide better customer service and earn higher profits to have better quality of life with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans by the quintal.

loans.name: Maureen Auxiladora

texts.es: Maureen es una mujer exitosa de 26 años de edad, soltera. Su negocio es la venta de cosmético de la Avon, y venta de ropa nueva desde hace 1 año,  ha demostrado ser una persona responsables en sus pagos su mama le ayuda a la comercialización de los cosméticos que distribuye  en su comunidad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como perfume de varón, perfumes de damas,  lapiz labiales, mascara, pintura de uñas, crema para manos, crema para pies, cremas faciales, crema para el cuerpo, ropa nueva como blusas, chores, camisetas, pantalones de mujer, pantalones de varón, etc.
texts.en: Maureen is a successful 26-year-old woman. She is single. Her business is selling Avon cosmetics and selling new clothes. She has been doing this for one year. She has shown herself to be responsible with her payments. Her mother helps her to sell the cosmetics, which she distributes in her community. She will invest the loan in purchasing cosmetics, such as cologne, perfume, lip liners, mascara, nail varnish, hand creams, foot creams, facial creams, and body creams, as well as new clothes, such as blouses, shorts, t-shirts, women’s pants, and men’s pants.

loans.use: to purchase Avon cosmetics, such as cologne, perfume, lip liners, mascara, nail varnish, hand creams, foot creams, facial creams, and body creams, as well as new clothes, such as blouses, shorts, t-shirts, women's pants, and men's pants

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 25 years old. He lives in Irbid-Jordan with his family which consists of five members. Mohammad is studying for his Bachelor of Cooling and Heating Engineering and is in his fourth year. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation to improve his financial situation. As Mohammad is currently facing a financial problem, he is requesting a loan to be able to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en: Ameena was born in 1956. She is single and lives in Madaba-Jordan. Ameena has been working in baking for five years. She started her project in the kitchen of her own house. Then she expanded her project and started working in an independent kitchen. Her future plan is to participate in bazaars and showrooms in the future to do some marketing for her work. Ameena is currently asking for a loan to buy flour in order to bake bread for her customers.

loans.use: To buy flour to bake bread

loans.name: Elva Lucia

texts.es:
Elva tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y la ganadería un trabajo que desempeña junto a su esposo e hijos, siempre se ha dedicado a estas actividades, nunca a desempeñado otra actividad.

 Ella tiene que caminar 30 minutos para salir del cantón y abordar el autobús que la lleva al pueblo donde compra los productos para su producción.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar vitaminas, desparasitantes, medicamentos para tratar enfermedades del ganado e insumos agrícolas como: abonos, herbicidas y pesticidas, para cultivar maíz y maicillo.


Al darle buen mantenimiento al ganado, aumentara la producción de leche y venderlo a mejor precio. Además, sembrar maíz y maicillo el que venderla y el sácate le servirá para alimentar a su ganado.

Desea, trabajar fuerte con su esposo para heredar a sus hijos algo del cual puedan trabajar o salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elva is 42 years old and is married with four children. She earns a living from agriculture and livestock, working alongside her husband and children. She has always done this kind of work and has never done anything else.

She has to walk for 30 minutes to leave the canton and catch the bus to the town where she buys the necessary supplies for her production.

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy vitamins, anti-parasite drugs, animal health medicines and agricultural supplies such as manure, weedkiller and pesticides to grow corn and sorghum.

By looking after the cattle well she will increase the milk production and sell it at a better price. In addition she will sow corn and sorghum to sell and hay which she will feed to the animals.

Her desire is to work hard with her husband in order to have something to pass on to their children which they can work with or prosper from.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, anti-parasite drugs, animal health medicines and agricultural supplies such as manure, weedkiller and pesticides to grow corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village in Pursat province’s Kandieng district, Long is 50 years old and she has three children to take care of. To feed her family, she and her husband have worked hard as rice farmers for 25 years. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Long has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is asking for another loan with VisionFund for 2,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for labor costs. She hopes to grow healthy rice and cassava to increase her family’s income and have a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Chorn is 55 years old and living with her family members in a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She is a married woman with seven children, two of whom are still in school. She has been farming rice for 12 years. The current business earns her about 13,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day for her future needs.

Chorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Chorn successfully used the loan from VisionFund to improve her family’s living conditions and now she is confident she can make a living better. Requesting a loan with VisionFund, Chorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Munir Group

texts.en: This group is called Munir and consists of four women. Shwaia is a 28-year-old married woman and comes from Taiz, Yemen. She is a hardworking housewife. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a larger fridge and to add more foodstuffs. She is aiming to have a business store to gain more profits so she has the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a larger fridge and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Al-Najat Group

texts.en: Al-Najat is a group consisting of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB. Najah is a 43-year-old married woman who has four children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to complete her building, but she suffers from a lack of money. So, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for building her house. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for building her house.

loans.name: Al-Sadaqa Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Sadaqa and is comprised of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. This community is hardworking, and they work as much as they can in order to offer better living conditions. They took out a loan of 180,000 YER. Taqia is the leader of the group. She is a married woman, and she is 60 years old. She lives with her children in Sana`a, Yemen. She has a small house. She went through a lot of effort and had to save money with her family, to set up her house. She is aiming to complete her house. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER, and she will use it to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es:
Santos tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y solo vive con uno de sus hijos. se dedica a sembrar maíz desde que tenia 20 años;  fue con su esposo que aprendió por la necesidad de apoyarlo  en traer el sustento para sus hijos,la llevo ha aprender, como beneficiar el cultivo. Luego que lo aprendió su esposo trabajaba para ganar para los frijoles y ella con sus pequeños hijos beneficiaban la milpa. hoy a sus 49 años  ella trabaja en una hacienda,pues su esposo era el que trabajaba, pero al morir,  la dejaron a ella en repuesto de él. A demás,  tiene unas 2 vacas, pues ella siempre, le han gustado los animales,ella dice que se levanta, a las 4:00 a.m. para hacer su desayuno, luego ir a dejar sus animales al potrero,y luego irse al trabajo que le queda como a unos 15 minutos, a pie de su casa,donde trabajan unas 6 horas, y luego regresa a casa,

Ella compra los materiales en la ciudad y para llegar   tiene que caminar a pie uno 35 minutos, pues ella vive a un kilómetro de la carretera, donde pasa el bus que la conduce a la ciudad el recorrido es de unos 40 minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  una bolsa de semilla, 10 sacos de abono, pesticidas y herbicidas. De esta forma, comprara  los insumos para el cultivo, pues el terreno ya lo tiene preparado pero  le hace falta el dinero para los insumos; por eso esta solicitando el préstamo y no dejar de cultivar, debido a que de ahí asegura el maíz para todo el año.  

Su sueño, es  construir su propia casa, pues hoy vive con su hijo; a demás sueña con poder comprar otras tres vacas y a futuro sueña con tener unas 5 vacas lecheras,
texts.en:
Santos, age 49, is a widow and lives with one of her children.  She has been growing corn since she was 20 years old.  It was with her husband that she learned about the need to support him in bringing sustenance to the children.  He taught her how to help the crop.  After she learned, her husband worked to earn a living.  She and her small children took care of the corn.

Now, at age 49, she works at a ranch.  Her husband was the one who worked, but upon his death they allowed her to replace him.  She also has two cows.  She has always liked animals.  She says that she gets up at 4:00 a.m. in order to make her breakfast.  She then goes to leave her animals at the pasture.  Then she goes to work, which takes her some 15 minutes walking from her house.  She works six hours and then returns home.

She buys the materials in the city.  In order to get there she needs to walk for 35 minutes.  She lives one kilometer from the road on which the bus to the city goes.  The trip is 40 minutes.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy a bag of seeds, ten sacks of fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.  This way she will buy the supplies for the crop.  She already has the land prepared, but she needs the money for the supplies.  That is why she is requesting the loan so that she can plant.  This will guarantee corn for the whole year.

Her dream is to build her own house.  She now lives with her son.  She also dreams of being able to buy three more cows.  In the future she dreams of having five dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy a bag of seeds, ten sacks of fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Es una persona de familia muy humilde quienes le enseñaron a luchar en la vida, aunque ella no tuvo el privilegio de ir a una escuela, gracias a sus esfuerzos aprendió a leer. se creció a lado de sus padres, viene de una familia de cinco hermanos (tres hembras y dos varones), quienes apoyaban a sus padres a trabajar en la agricultura y a la elaboración de cumas y machetes (jarcia).

A los quince años, se acompaño con su esposo, luego con el tiempo se casaron por la iglesia, ahora tiene cinco hijos (tres hembras de 20,12 y 7 años, y dos varones de 18 y 15 años), tres de ellos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, les queda a cinco minutos caminando, su hija mayor le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar, y su hijo trabaja de ayudante de albañil con su padre quien trabaja la albañilería.

Ella hace 20 años comenzó a vender especies (ajo, achote, canela, cominos, pimienta, y otros), vende también ropa en ocasiones en las comunidades aledañas, ademas hace dos años comenzó a destazar cerdos para vender en los caseríos del pueblo.

la mercadería,  la  va comprar hasta la ciudad que esta ubicada en otro departamento, y lo hace acompañada de su esposo; tiene que pagar un carro particular que le haga el viaje, el cual lo hace cada dos veces al mes, le toma de tiempo una hora para llegar a la ciudad donde compra las especies.

Los cerdos los compra en la comunidad y los va ha destazar donde su mamá; pues esta fuera del pueblo y ahí obtiene mejores ingresos económicos. todos los sábados destaza cerdos, se va un día antes a quedarse donde su madre para madrugar a las tres de la mañana a destazar, lo hace en compañía de su hijo, quien es el que puede destazar y ella prepara para ir a vender.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa para vender en la temporada de las vacaciones de agosto, invertirá $300.00 (ropa para todas las edades) y a demás invertirá $300 en la compra de tres cerdos para el destazo, y el resto lo invertirá en la compra de especies.

con el crédito, dispondrá de un inventario mayor para la venta de su mercadería (especies), ademas podrá garantizar su trabajo en el destazo los días sábados en la comunidad, pues tendrá los tres cerdos que ira destazando cada semana. Obtendrá mayores ingresos económicos para su familia, pues es ella quien le ayuda al esposo para darles lo necesario a sus hijos, es conocedora del negocio de las ventas.

 sueña construir una casa de bloque en el futuro, y seguir ayudando a sus hijos en el estudio. pues gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado comprar dos terrenos , que es donde ella vive.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old, married and has five children. She is a homemaker. She is very humble. She had to learn how to work, as she doesn’t have the benefit of an education. Thanks to her own efforts, she did learn how to read. She grew up in her parent’s home. She has five siblings (three females and two males) who help support her parent’s work in agriculture. Her parents also make machetes and long knives. At fifteen years old she was married in the church. She has five children (three girls who are 20, 12 and 7 years old and two boys who are 18 and 15 years old). Three of her children study at the school in her community. The school is a five-minute walk from their house. Her oldest daughter helps with the housework. Her son assists his father, who is a bricklayer. For the past twenty years Maria has sold spices (garlic, cinnamon, cumin, paprika among other types of spices). She also sometimes sells clothes in the neighboring villages. Also, two years ago, she began to butcher pigs. She sells the meat to households in the village. She buys her merchandise in the city, which is located in another department. He husband goes with her when she travels to the city. She has to hire a car to get to the city. She makes this trip two times a month. It takes an hour to get to the city where she buys her goods. She buys the pigs in her community and she butchers them at her mother’s house. This house is located outside of her village. This location is good for sales. Every Saturday she butchers pigs. She goes to her mother’s house on Friday so she can get up at three in the morning to butcher the pigs. Her son comes with her. Her son actually butchers the pigs and she sells the meat. The loan, that she is requesting, from the Countryside Foundation, will be used to buy clothes that she will sell during the August vacation season. She will invest $300.00 in clothes for all ages. The other $300.00 she will use to buy three pigs that will be butchered. The rest of the money will be used to buy spices on credit. She will then have a larger inventory of spices to sell. She will also be able to guarantee that she will have pork to sell on Saturdays. She will have three pigs, which will last her three weeks. This will give her family a larger income. She helps her husband to provide the necessary items for their children. With the earnings from her businesses she hopes to build a concrete house and also help her children with their education. Thanks to her efforts, she has already purchased two pieces of land, which is where she lives.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell during the August vacations season. She will invest $300.00 in clothing for all ages, $300.00 in three pigs that she will butcher and the rest of the money will be used to buy spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off a loan with another institution and to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.es:
