The goal of this loan is to make improvements to his vehicle and his mobile disco equipment.

loans.use: Service his taxi and make improvements to his mobile disco equipment.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 39-year-old man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a small crockery store, named “Usman Crockery Store”, in which he sells crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glasses, jugs, mugs, and buckets
. 
Ashraf is the father of five children and the single responsible person who has to feed them. He has only one source of income from which he has to afford all the expenses of utility bills, his children's school fees and household expenses. His house condition is not up to the mark for living.

Ashraf wants to construct his house: for this purpose, more earnings are required so that he can save some money for construction. He has requested a loan of Rs. 170,000 from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he can increase his inventory of crockery as well as his earnings.

Ashraf hopes that he will be able to construct his house soon, so that his family members will  live more comfortably. He is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed him a ray of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: To buy crockery to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like spices, cooking oil, egg noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store business. Shirley has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from a shoe repair shop.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of having enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like spices, cooking oil, egg noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela is 51 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows tomatoes, cucumbers and melons that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years.

Ela needs a loan to buy a garden spade, fertilizer, a pickaxe, a garden hose and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Ela will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a garden spade, fertilizer, a pickaxe, a garden hose and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Amazonas De Huayna Potosi Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAZONAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI II” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de zapatos, venta de champoo, venta de accesorios de celulares, venta de ropa, macramé de mantas, venta de ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas a macramé; da a conocer que esta técnica la aprendió desde niña y desde esa fecha emprendió este negocio que le genera remuneración.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su mercadería (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “Amazonas de Huayna Potosi II” Community Bank is beginning their seventh loan cycle with “Pro Women”, the central focus of German Busch. The group is made up of nine members and is run buy a board of directors, whose president is Virginia. The members have various types of businesses. Among these businesses are making blankets, selling shoes, selling shampoo, selling cell phone accessories, selling clothes, knotting blankets and selling hardware. The loans will benefit small businesses, such as the one run by Virginia. She has been a member of Pro Woman for the past three years. She was invited to be a member by a friend that is also a member. She has a business weaving macramé blankets. She learned how to do this as a child. From that time forward she has been in this business that has generated income.The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy more supplies (such as wool), which she buys at the neighborhood markets. She sells her work at a booth in the market. This work allows her to earn resources to be used to maintain her home, as she is married with two children.
When she was asked why she likes “Pro Woman”, she answered that she likes the ability to get loans and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel is 28 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as a carpenter and she helps him by growing and selling vegetables in the community. She has been doing this for many years to earn a living.

Lizel is borrowing a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy fertilizer such as manure and to build a fence for her garden. She is planning to cultivate another plot of garden to increase her earnings to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure and  to build a fence for her garden

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Doña maría es originaria de León, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 4 años por el cual trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para sacarlo adelante. Inicio vendiendo de manera ambulante productos derivados del maíz Tales como: pozol, pinolillo, tiste, etc a  la edad de 15 años. Con el tiempo logro conseguir un local en el mercado donde comercializa sus productos, en este negocio la apoya su mama. Está solicitando el préstamo para comprar carne de cerdo, cebolla, chiltoma, tomates, arroz y quintales de maíz con el fin de elaborar nacatamales producto derivados del maíz de esta manera ofrecer variedad , ampliar sus productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Sus metas a futuro es contratar personal que distribuyan sus productos en zonas establecidas y llegar adquirir negocio de pulpería muy surtida.
texts.en:
Doña María, 34, comes from León and is a single mother of a 4 year old boy. She works hard so that he can get ahead in life. She began selling corn products, such as pozol (a pork and hominy stew), pinolillo and tiste (beverages made of cornmeal and cacao), and others, as a street vendor at the age of 15. Over time, she managed to acquire a space in the market where she can sell her products; her mother helps her with this business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase pork, onions, sweet peppers, tomatoes, rice, and quintals of corn to make nacatamales (corn, meat, and rice wrapped in a banana leaf), in order to offer some variety, expand her products, and satisfy her customers' needs. Her future goals are to hire staff to distribute her products in established zones and acquire a well-supplied convenience store.

loans.use: to buy pork, onions, sweet peppers, tomatoes, rice, and quintals of corn.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es:
Don Mario es originario de la ciudad de león, tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad.  Él es taxista desde hace 36 años, oficio con el cual ha sacado adelante a su familia gracias a esta actividad  logro pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
 Solicita el crédito para mantenimiento y reparación de su taxi,  de esta manera  brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes. Sus planes futuros son comprar un taxi y un microbús para adquirir una línea que ofrezca transporte fuera de la ciudad, uno de sus más grandes apoyos es su hija mayor  que lo ha respaldado. Esta agradecido por el apoyo que Kiva y MiCredito le está brindado a través del préstamo el cual va utilizar para dar mejor mantenimiento e imagen  a su taxi.
texts.en:
Don Mario is from the city of León, and is 56 years old. He is married and has two adult children. He has been a taxi driver for 36 years; with this job, he has provided for his family, and thanks to this job, he managed to pay for his children's university studies.

He is requesting a loan to maintain and repair his taxi, in order to provide better service for his clients. His future plans are to purchase a taxi and a microbus, to acquire a line that offers transportation outside of the city. One of his greatest sources of support is his eldest daughter, who has backed him. He is grateful for the support that Kiva and MiCredito are providing him through this loan, which he will use to improve the maintenance and appearance of his taxi.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Sanu Maiya

texts.en: Sanu Maiya is 35 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 16, 11, and 4. Many years ago, she established her meat shop business.  Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy chickens and buffalo meat. In the future, Sanu Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy meat for her shop

loans.name: Luisito

texts.en:
Luisito previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more hogs that were needed for his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan that he will be utilizing to buy more hogs that he can sell. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Luisito dreams that his business will flourish and hopes to have a happy and peaceful life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more hogs for his business.

loans.name: Musuu

texts.en:
Musuu took out her first Kiva loan and repaid it before time so she could access a bigger loan to properly fund her business. She lives in Mariakani where she runs a grocery store. Her business is growing and she wants to expand. Musuu says that, in the next five years, she wants to buy a plot and set up her business on her own land and stop paying a lot of money for rent. 

Musuu knew about Milango through friends and now she is seeking a loan to buy 100 kg of tomatoes and 100 kg of cabbages. The major challenges that she faces and has to deal with are the high costs of transport and competition. She commented that she wants to be able to secure loans with low interest.

loans.use: to buy 100 kg of tomatoes and 100 kg of cabbages.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school, She works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, chips, noodles, shampoo, soap, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Josephine would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, chips, noodles, shampoo, soap, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Alcira Argentina

texts.es: Alcira Argentina, 49 años de edad soltera con un hijo independiente, originaria de una de las comarcas del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Alcira se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada, responsables, con muchos deseos de superación en la vida, a ella en sus ratos libres le gusta mucho disfrutar el atardecer con un delicioso café con leche y galletas escuchando música de recuerdos, desde muy pequeña ella comienza a trabajar para aportar en los gastos de su hogar pero después ella forma uno y al verse madre soltera sale nuevamente a trabajar para sufragar gastos en su hogar, vendiendo golosinas en los mercados, paradas de buses, logrando recaudar un pequeño ahorro el cual inicia una pequeña venta de golosinas en su casa de habitación, pero con muchos esfuerzos y poco a poco ella incrementa su negocio convirtiéndolo en una pulpería debido a que ella ya tenía conocimientos de este negocio por parte de su mama, Alcira ofrece productos como: granos  básicos, cosméticos, chinerías, productos congelados, venta de ropa variadas entre otros, ella tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al crédito los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal, el financiamiento de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo como en la compra de granos básicos para la pulpería y en variedad de ropa.
texts.en:
49-year old Alcira Argentina is a single mother with an adult son. She is a native of one of the neighbourhoods of the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country. Alcira is a hardworking, honorable, responsible woman with a great desire to get ahead in life. In her spare time she greatly enjoys relaxing in the evening with a milky coffee and cookies and listening to her favorite music.

Alcira started work as a young child so she could help support her family. Then later she became a single mother and again went out to work to pay for household expenses, selling candy in the markets and bus stops. She managed to save a bit of money and used it to open a small candy stall in her house. Eventually and after much effort the business became a grocery store, a business she already knew about from her mother.

Alcira sells products such as basic grains, cosmetics, nicknacks, frozen food, and items of clothing. She has regular and occasional customers to whom she extends credit, collecting payments weekly or twice a month. She plans to use the money from this loan to buy basic grains for the grocery store and a variety of clothing.

loans.use: Buy basic grains, cosmetics, nicknacks, and clothing etc.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona lives in Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a farmer planting rice in their own farm for it is their main source of income. She helped him work in their garden and is the one selling harvested vegetables in the market. She has been doing this since she got married to help improve their living situation. 

Chona borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she had joined in 2010 in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to have an abundant harvest and able to save her income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 39 years old and lives in Naivasha. He is married with three children.

Julius has a peanut-selling business that he has been running for the past five years and has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy peanuts to add to his stock.

He hopes to open up a wholesale shop of peanuts in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts to add to his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Leyton Isidro

texts.es:
Leyton tiene 28 años de edad de estado soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Leyton se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero comprar mas terrenos

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Leyton is 28 years old, single and without children. He lives with his parents in Ventana City in the province of Los Rios. He is a member of the VRC Christ the King which is located in The Canal area which is in The Ventanas Canton. People who live in this canton work in agriculture and fishing. 
Leyton works as a farmer, growing corn and beans. He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure, and weed killer. He buys these products in the city of Ventanas. With the help of this loan, he is able to buy these supplies. There are challenges in farming such as diseases and illnesses. His dream is to have more money to buy more land. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and weed killer.

loans.name: María Norela

texts.es: Norela, con 44 años de edad, es una mujer casada y madre de 3 hijos. Nació y se crió en el campo, razón por la cual tiene amplios conocimientos en las labores agropecuarias. Actualmente posee algunas cabezas de ganado lechero al cual ordeña para vender la producción de leche en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside, adicionalmente complementa esta actividad, con la cría y cuidado de cerdos y pollos, aumentando así sus ingresos para poder contribuir al sostenimiento de su hogar. Norela es una persona emprendedora, juiciosa y dedicada a su familia; su esposo y sus hijos son la principal motivación para  levantarse todos los días a trabajar y a buscar nuevas oportunidades de salir adelante. Por eso solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de más vacas productoras de leche (2 vacas), de esta forma aumentará la producción del líquido y podrá venderlo a un mejor precio en el mercado. Esto le abrirá más posibilidades para lograr cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, donde le pueda brindar un mejor bienestar a sus hijos y una estabilidad económica favorable para que tengan un futuro más próspero.
texts.en: Norela is 44 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She was born and raised in the country and this is the reason she has extensive knowledge of agricultural work.  Currently, she has some heads of dairy cattle that she milks. She sells the milk in the market square of the town where she lives.  In addition, she compliments this activity with the breeding and care of pigs and chickens.  In this way, she increases her income and is able to contribute to the support of her household.  Norela is enterprising, sensible, and dedicated to her family.  Her husband and her children are the main reason for getting up every day to work and seek new opportunities to succeed.  For this reason she is requesting the loan, with the goal of investing in the purchase of two more dairy cows.  In this way, she will increase milk production and be able to sell it at a better price at the market.  This will open up more possibilities to her and enable her to fulfill her dream of having her own farm where she can better provide for her children’s welfare and favorable financial stability so that they will have a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase two more dairy cows.

loans.name: Melvin Evelio

texts.es: Melvin, tiene  23 años de edad, vive en  unión libre con su pareja, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Siguatepeque. Desde muy joven realiza actividades agrícolas. Hace 5 años que cultiva su propia finca de café. La producción la vende en el mercado local siendo esta su fuente de ingresos. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado por 15,000 lempiras va comprar fertilizantes para darle un buen mantenimiento a la finca de café y sacar buena producción. Su plan es salir adelante con su familia obteniendo buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Melvin is 23 years old. He has a life partner and two children whom he lives with, in the Municipality of Siguatepeque. He has worked in agriculture since he was quite young. For the last 5 years he has had his own coffee plantation. Producing and selling the coffee in the local markets is his source of income. The 15,000 Lempiras loan Melvin has requested will be used to buy fertilizer to maintain his crops and to produce a high yield. His plan is to get his family ahead by making a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
This is Domingo's 10th loan cycle. He is very thankful for the help that he's getting ever since he started acquiring loans. His income helped him in his business and also in their household expenditures. He and his wife, who is a vendor, are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Domingo dreams to be more successful and hopes to have a better living. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle (motorcycle transport vehicle).

loans.name: Renan

texts.en:
This is Renan. He previously received an 18,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase scrap materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund that is used to buy scrap materials. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Renan dreams to see his business flourishing and hopes for a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business every week and to draw strength from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a business that buys and sells spices in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of spices to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Renafe

texts.en:
Renafe lives in Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental province with her husband and three children. Her husband works as a private employee, and she is the one who manages their banana farm to earn a living.

Renafe is applying for a 8,500 PHP loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to cover the costs of weeding, maintaining and replanting her farm. From this loan she hopes to get another plot of land for bananas and give her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the costs of weeding, maintaining and replanting her farm.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the Changamwe area where he runs an electronics repair shop. He is single and has been running the business for the last five years. He learned of Milango through friends at a time when he needed financing for the business. This business is the sole activity that gives him income. 

The major challenge that he faces is the high cost of spare parts and clients not paying for his services in good time. He now seeks a loan to buy tools and other working equipment that will enhance his service delivery and allow him to serve more customers. 

Moses is grateful to Milango. He has been able to get loans before being listed on Kiva and he is grateful that he can be able to run his business without the challenges of funding.

loans.use: to buy working tools and equipment.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 48 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past two years Fe has sold prepared food from her stall in the Philippines. She is applying for a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional meat, hotdogs, etc. to sell.

Fe would like to grow her business to secure her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional meat, hotdogs, etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 59 years old and married with seven children. She has been farming vegetables in the Philippines for 9 years and also earns additional income from farming rice. Luz is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy new vegetable seeds and farm supplies for her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new vegetable seeds and farm supplies for her business

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie. She previously received a 24,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories as well as to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvie hopes that her tricycle will always be in good condition and dreams that her family will always be happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and so she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories as well as to pay for maintenance on the motorized tricycle.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt: Paulina, é casada e mãe de 1 filha,que ainda frequenta pré-escola. Tem 34 anos de idade, é professora e estudante universitária. A casa onde vive está ainda em construção. Com o dinheiro deste empréstimo vai comprar cimento, varões e areia para aumentar mais um quarto e cozinha visto que a casa só tem um quarto e sala. No futuro pretende construir uma pequena escola privada. Terminar a faculdade é o seu maior desafio para mudar de categoria no serviço e auferir salário um pouco digno de modo a lograr seus planos.
texts.en: Paulina is married and has a daughter who's still in preschool. She's 34 years old, and she's a teacher and a college student. The house where she lives is still under construction. With the money from this loan she'll purchase cement, rods and sand so that she can build another bedroom and a kitchen, since the house only has one bedroom and a living room. In the future she intends to build a little private school. Finishing college is her biggest challenge. That way she'll upgrade her career status and get a fairly decent salary so she can achieve her plans.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, rods, sand) in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Jasmin works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Jasmin is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, wood, paint, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat. Diana has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from furniture making. Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, wood, paint, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Silvana Karina

texts.es:
Silvana tiene 20 años de edad de estado soltera  tiene 2 hijos, vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Silvana se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero comprar mas terrenos

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer y caminar
texts.en: Silvana, 20, is single and has two children. She lives with her family in the city of Ventanas, Los Rios province. She is a member of the Cristo Rey communal bank, which is located in the El Cañal area. It's part of Ventanas canton where they work in agriculture and ranching. Silvana works in agriculture, planting corn and pigeon peas. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, manure, and liquid herbicide. She will buy the products in the city of Ventanas. She will be able to buy these supplies with the help of the loan. She faces challenges like infestations and illnesses. Her dream is to have money to buy more land. In her free time, she likes to read and go for walks.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, manure, and liquid herbicide.

loans.name: Vivian Antonio

texts.es:
Vivian es un joven originario de Teustepe, Boaco. Tiene 29 años de edad y es padre de un  niño de 3 años. Se dedica a la actividad de siembra de maíz y frijol. Aprendió a trabajar con sus padres y hermanos a los 8 años de edad. Por medio de la siembra de maíz y frijol obtiene ganancias que ayuda a su familia. Él tiene como expectativa seguir trabajando para que su producto llegue a un mercado mejor. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos tales como: fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra. El crédito lo ayudara a obtener una mejor producción. Su meta futuro es mejorar su humilde casa.
texts.en: Vivian is a young man originally from Teustepe, Boaco. He is 29 years old and has a three-year-old son. He works sowing corn and beans. He learned to work with his parents and brothers when he was eight years old. By planting corn and beans, he earns money that helps his family. He hopes to continue working so that his product reaches a better market. He is asking for the loan to buy supplies like fertilizers and manure, and to pay laborers. The loan will help him to have greater production. His goal for the future is to improve his humble house.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers and manure, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Raul Alberto

texts.es:
Raul tiene 28 años de edad de estado soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC CRISTO REY, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto El Cañal, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedica a labores agricolas y pecuarias.

Raul se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol galdúl. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas y enfermedades. El sueño es tener dinero comprar mas terrenos

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Raul, 28, is single and does not have any children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Rios province. He is a member of the Cristo Rey communal bank, which is located in the El Cañal area. It is part of Ventanas canton, where they work in agriculture and ranching. Raul works in agriculture, planting corn and pigeon peas. He is asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, manure, and liquid herbicide. He will buy the products in the city of Ventanas. He will be able to buy the supplies with the help of the loan. He faces challenges like infestations and illnesses. His dream is to have money to buy more land. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, manure, and liquid herbicide.

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es: Cleotilde, tiene 58 años de edad, es casada,  tiene seis hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Ella tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. La finca de café la tiene en la montaña. También cultiva granos básicos. El café lo vende en pergamino y en uva en el mercado local de la zona. A ella le ayuda su esposo para realizar el cultivo. El préstamo que Cleotilde solicito es por L. 5,000 y los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para sus cultivos y limpieza de los mismos. Su meta es poder cultivar mas café y poderle dar la mejor asistencia.
texts.en: Cleotilde is 58 years old and is married. She has six children and lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years and owns a coffee farm in the mountains. She also grows basic grains. She sells the coffee both before processing and after from the local market. Her husband also helps her with the harvest of the plant. The loan that Cleotilde is requesting is for L. 5,000 which she will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and manure for her crops and to carry out cleaning for these plants. Her goal is to be able to harvest more coffee and attend to her farm as best as she can.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and carry out cleaning for her coffee farm.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.pt: Xavier é motorista de uma empresa privada e trabalha 8 horas diárias. Estudou até à 7a classe, é casado, pai de 7 filhos dos quais dois estudam frequentando o nível primário e secundário. Vive na casa própria e sustenta sua família. Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar blocos, areia, cimento e varões para construção de muro de vedação da sua casa. No futuro pretende ampliar a sua casa visto que agora tem 2 quartos e sala apenas e sustentar os estudos dos filhos que ainda estão na sua responsabilidade.
texts.en: Xavier is a driver for a private company and works 8 hours a day. He completed 7th grade. He's married and has 7 children, two of whom attend primary and high school. He lives in a house that he owns and supports his family. With the money from the loan he'll purchase bricks, sand, cement and rods in order to build a surrounding wall around his house. In the future he intends to enlarge his house, since currently it only has two bedrooms and a living room. He also intends to support his children's education who are still under his responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand and rods) in order to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en: Flaviana is 67 years old, married and has eight children. She is in the agricultural business farming corn in the Philippines. Flaviana requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt: José é polícia há mais de 5 anos, trabalha em turnos, tem nível médio, é casado, tem um filho menor ainda a frequentar a pré-escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua família da qual fazem parte dois enteados. O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de cimento, varões e chapas para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa, visto estar fazendo em partes, e desta vez vai rebocar e cobrir a cozinha e mais um quarto pois a casa só tinha dois quartos e sala. No futuro pretende terminar a casa e mobilar a mesma. Vai economizar mais os fundos para lograr os seus planos.
texts.en: José has been a police officer for over 5 years and works by shifts. He finished high school. He's married and has an underage son who's still in preschool. He lives in a house that he owns and supports his family which is also comprised of two stepchildren. The money from the loan will be used to purchase cement, rods and metal sheets so he can continue building his house. He's been doing that gradually, and this time he'll plaster and cover the kitchen and another bedroom, since the house only had two bedrooms and a living room. In the future he intends to finish the house and furnish it. He'll save the funds in order to accomplish his plans.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, rods and metal sheets) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: As a married mother of six children, Aida works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Aida is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant. Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Mario

texts.pt: Mário e militar e tem nível superior, trabalha 8 horas diárias, e casado e pai de 2 filhos, que estão no nível primário, sustenta sua família e vive no bairro militar na casa cedida pelo governo. O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de pedra, cimento, areia, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa própria. No futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa e colocar mobila. Quando fechar o empréstimo voltara a solicitar mais para lograr os seus planos.
texts.en: Mário is a serviceman and a college graduate. He works 8 hours a day. He's married and has two children who attend elementary school. He supports his family and lives in the military quarter, in a house provided by the government. The money from the loan will be used to purchase rocks, cement and sand, so he can continue building a house of his own. In the future he intends to finish building his house and furnish it. Once he repays the loan he'll apply for other loans again, so that he can accomplish his plans.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (rocks, cement, sand) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap, crackers and cooking oil for re-selling.

loans.name: Maria Ubaldina

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 57 años, estudió y aprobó la educación de la escuela primaria, trabajó desde muy joven aprendiendo distintas labores desde los quehaceres del hogar hasta la fabricación de bloques de cemento. María es soltera y a sus 23 años tuvo un hijo que ahora ya tiene su propia familia con quienes María vive en Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. Aunque hay un alto índice de pobreza el espíritu emprendedor de sus habitantes ha hecho que la  ciudad sobresalga. En el sector rural y urbano se puede encontrar familias destacando sus talentos para emprender con alguna idea que les pueda generar rentabilidad para conseguir el sustento diario. 
María aprendió a elaborar bloques de cemento para la construcción de casas gracias a la instrucción de su hermana con quien trabajó mucho tiempo en esta labor, hace 2 años decidió emprender el negocio por sí misma, poniendo en práctica la experiencia que ganó con su hermana. María invierte al menos 8 horas cada día en la preparación del material, elaboración y arrumando los bloques, labor cuyos procesos tienen un nivel de dificultad alto y hasta riesgoso, sin embargo María ha continuado con la esperanza de un día cumplir su sueño de tener su casa propia para así tener una vejez tranquila y confortable. María solicita un préstamo para invertir en material e insumos para la elaboración de sus bloques, pues en ocasiones la falta de algún insumo o material detiene la producción y por lo general los pedidos son siempre al por mayor, por lo que María no puede permitirse una falta de producto, sin embargo en ocasiones ha perdido ventas ya que no podía abastecerse de materia prima por la falta de capital, sin embargo alguien le recomendó ir a solicitar el crédito en Fundación Alternativa en donde gracias al producto Kiva, le pueden prestar la ayuda económica que necesita para seguir produciendo y crecer en su negocio y de esta forma sumar sus ganancias con lo cual puede aportar al mejoramiento de calidad de vida de su hijo, nuera y nietos con quienes vive.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old. She studied and passed primary school, and has worked since she was very young, learning different jobs ranging from household chores to making cement blocks. She is single, and when she was 23 years old, she had a son, who now has his own family, with whom María lives in Latacunga, which is the capital of the province of Cotopaxi.

Cotopaxi is one of the provinces that make up the mountainous region of Ecuador. In recent years it has experienced a significant amount of development, such that it is now considered one of the most important of the region, thanks to its flower-growing, mining, metallurgy, agribusiness, agriculture and livestock industries. Latacunga, moreover, has many businesses that generate significant revenues and which make it a city of commerce with various opportunities to get ahead. Although there is a high poverty index, the entrepreneurial spirit of its inhabitants has made the city excel. There are families in both the rural and urban sectors that stand out for their talent for pursuing an idea that can generate profit for them and permit them to meet their daily needs.

María learned to make cement blocks for building houses from her sister, with whom she worked for a long time. Two years ago she decided to start her own business, putting into practice the experience she gained while working with her sister. María invests at least eight hours every day preparing the raw material, making the bricks and then piling them up. All of these tasks have a high level of difficulty and are even risky. Nevertheless, María has continued with her work with the hope that one day she will achieve her dream, which is to have her own home so that she can live out her later years in peace and comfort.

María is requesting a loan to buy materials and supplies for making cement blocks. She says that sometimes she does not have some of the necessary materials or supplies for making cement blocks and that this stops her production. She also says that in general the orders are always in bulk, so that she cannot permit herself to run out of product. Unfortunately, on occasions she has lost sales because she has not had some primary materials in stock because of a lack of capital. Someone recommended that she request a loan from the field partner, where, she says thanks to Kiva, they can give her the economic help that she needs to continue production, grow her business and increase her profits. With these profits, she hopes to improve the quality of life of her son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren with whom she lives.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for making cement blocks.

loans.name: Inacio

texts.pt:
Inácio é casado, tem 5 filhos, dos quais 2 estudam frequentando o nível primário. Ele estudou até à sexta classe e hoje trabalha como segurança de uma empresa privada, por turnos. Ele tem também um salão de cabeleireiro que está sob gerência da sua esposa.
Com o dinheiro deste empréstimo vai comprar pentes, geles, escovas e mechas para o seu salão. No futuro pretende comprar uma máquina de soldar e passar a prestar pequenos serviços de serralharia nos dias de folga do serviço e assim poderá colectar mais dinheiro para o sustento da família.
texts.en:
Inácio is married and has five children, two of whom attend elementary school. He completed 6th grade and currently works as a security guard for a private company. He works by shifts and also owns a hairdressing salon which is managed by his wife.
With the money from this loan he'll purchase combs, hair gel, brushes and hair extensions for his hairdressing salon. In the future he intends to buy a welding machine and begin providing small metalwork services on his days off from work. That way he'll obtain more money to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair gel, brushes and hair extensions for his hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Rostalina

texts.pt: Rostalina é solteira e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam o nível primário e secundário, e o mais novo não tem ainda idade escolar. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos. Trabalha como agente de serviço num hospital público durante 8 horas diárias. A casa onde vive ainda não está concluída, isto é constrói pouco a pouco por causa dos escassos recursos financeiros, por isso o dinheiro do recente empréstimo vai aplicar na compra de areia, cimento, arcos de janela, para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa. No futuro pretende construir dependências para o arrendamento de modo a arrecadar mais dinheiro para o sustento dos filhos. No futuro vai trabalhar mais, e fazer mais empréstimos na Hluvuku de modo a lograr os seus projectos.
texts.en: Rostalina is single and has three children who attend primary and high school. The youngest child hasn't reached school age yet. She lives with her children in a house that she owns. She works an 8-hour day as a service agent in a public hospital. The house where she lives isn't finished yet, that is to say, she's been building it little by little due to scarce financial resources. That's why the money from the recent loan will be used to purchase sand, cement and window frames so she can continue building her house. In the future she intends to build rooms for renting out so that she can obtain more money to support her children. In the future she'll work harder and get more loans from Hluvuku in order to accomplish her projects.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and window frames in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Teodoro Armando

texts.es: Teodoro Armando, mayor de edad casado con tres hijos, todos independientes, originario del municipio de chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, Teodoro se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, luchador responsable, con ganas de superación personal, es propietario de un negocio de venta de granos básicos como: venta de arroz, frijoles , azúcar, aceite, jabón, maíz entre otros productos mas, el cual lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercados de este municipio, al igual que tiene un tramo de reparación de calzados en el mismo mercado, inicia este negocio con fondos propios de ahorros que el tenia de sus otros trabajos, uno de sus sueños es en un futuro no muy lejano poder adquirir otro tramo para venta de mariscos en el mismo local, el financiamiento de este crédito es para reforzar su capital de trabajo y comprar granos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, aceite, carbón, avenas, hamacas entre otros mas, Teodoro agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les brindan a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Teodoro Armando is a married adult with three children, all independent. He is from the city of Chinandega, an area where commerce predominates. Teodoro is a hard-working man, responsible and a fighter, with a desire for personal growth. He owns a business selling staple goods such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, and corn, among other products. It is located in one of the markets of this city. He also has a shoe repair stall in the same market. He started this business with his own savings that he had from his other jobs. One of his dreams is to be able to acquire another stall to sell seafood in the not-so-distant future. The money from this loan is to reinforce his working capital and to buy staple items such as rice, sugar, corn, beans, oil, charcoal, oats, and hammocks, among other items. Teodoro is very thankful for the support that the Kiva investors give to people with scarce economic resources.

loans.use: for working capital to buy staple goods such as: rice, charcoal, sugar, beans, salt, and detergent, among other products

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Don Carlos es originario del municipio de Teustepe, Boaco. Tiene 39 años de edad, casado y con 3 hijos. Se dedica a la ganadería,  siembra de maíz y frijol. Él está agradecido con kiva y MiCredito ya que atravez de ellos pudo aumentar sus ingresos. Este nuevo crédito lo solicita para comprar unos terneros.
Su meta futuro es comprar una finca que este cerca de la carretera con acceso al agua para poder construir una casa.
texts.en: Carlos is a native of the municipality of Teustepe, in the department of Boaco. He is 39 years old, married, and has three children. He works raising cattle, and growing corn and beans. He says that he is grateful to Kiva and the field partner because through them he was able to increase his income. He is requesting a new loan to buy calves. His future goal is to buy a property that is near the road with access to water so that he can build a house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a woman who understands the importance of going to school. She missed this great chance herself and has vowed to pay every school bill until her children reach the highest level in school that they can.

Monica operates a medium-sized retail shop which is one of her major sources of income. She is an honest, hardworking and focused woman with whom one would want to work. She is applying for a 2,000,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy more goods to sell to her clients.

Monica is grateful for the UGAFODE and Kiva partnership and believes it is her stepping stone to achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Nazma

texts.en:
Nazma, a 29-year-old, hardworking woman, lives in Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a driver. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Nazma is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business, if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Nazma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine, to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for her family's future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia and her family live in Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as a fisherman, and she helps him to earn a living by planting and harvesting vegetables, to sell in their community. For ten years of selling vegetables, she has earned not less than 2,000 a month.

In 2009 she joined GDMPC, and she gained access to microfinance services. Recently, Virginia borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer, such as manure. She hopes to improve her vegetable garden and have an abundant harvest, and thereby to gain more income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia, 35, is a housewife who adores her family. Her husband is a blacksmith who works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. His work is the family’s only source of income.

Fauzia is applying for a 25,000 PKR loan through Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. She will use the loan to buy tools for her husband’s work. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to pay for his household’s needs.

Fauzia hopes that the loan will help her husband's business. She is thankful for Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools for her husband's work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jardines Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDINES DEL SUR”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de flores, venta de productos de belleza, venta de víveres, venta de edredones y esponjas, tienda de barrio, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comida (churrasquería); este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo, ya que este es cheff, esa oportunidad fue aprovechada para emprender su negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de platos y cubiertos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente los utilizara para realizar el servicio en su negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, el ahorro y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "JARDINES DEL SUR" [SOUTHERN GARDENS] communal bank is beginning its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the Villa Tejada Regional Office, it is made up of nine members and is directed by a board, of which Angelica is the treasurer. The members of the communal association participate in a variety of businesses, among them candy sales, flower sales, beauty product sales, grocery sales, eiderdown and sponge sales, a corner store, and food sales.

The loan that they intend to take out will benefit the small business owners that Angelica is a member of. She reports that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for ten years, entering by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a food business (barbecue stand). She started this business together with her spouse. Since he is a chef, they took advantage of this opportunity to start their family business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (purchase of plates and cutlery). She will acquire this from the fairs in the city of El Alto and then will use it to provide service in her business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible, since she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, her response is that she likes the loans, the savings and the health services.

loans.use: to purchase plates and cutlery

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking mother, who is doing what she can to support her family. She is in the business of tailoring. She has been doing this work for three years, now. Her income from her business has been helping her children, who are all in school. Her husband, also a tailor, also works so their dream for their family will come to life.

She would like to apply for another loan, this one in the amount of 12,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies of fabric, thread and other materials, to use in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs, including the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maribel hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having their own house and lot. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread and other materials, to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 45-year-old lady from the Homabay region, in the western part of Kenya. Emily is a widow and supports two people in her family. She has two adult children, 20 and 25-years-old respectively.

Emily's main business is tailoring and she has been in this business for the last four years. She earns a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). Emily has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase material for making new clothes. She will use her anticipated profit to expand the business.

Emily's dream is to have a stable business that gives her a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase material for making new clothes.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 41-years-old, married and blessed with two children, aged six and four years respectively. 

Andrew owns a retail shop where he sells a variety of goods. He started this business 13 years ago and earns a monthly income of 35,400 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

Andrew has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase milk, bread, boxes of biscuits, packets of sweets and bars of soap. The profit he earns will help him to expand this business. Andrew hopes to see his business grow and hopes to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread, boxes of biscuits, packets of sweets and bars of soap.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur, who retails onions in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years, and she earns additional income from a restaurant business.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell to her customers. Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more onions to sell.

loans.name: Bensie

texts.en:
Bensie is 37-years-old, married and lives in Rizal, Jimenez. She runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Bensie has been in business for more than six years and earns 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month.

Bensie has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy canned goods, bottled products and seasoning. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bottled products and seasoning

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
Felimon is married to Veronica and a father to their children. He received a previous loan, which was a big help in his business. The extra income stemming from his loan helped him to send his children to school and meet the family’s everyday expenses. He and his wife are helping each other support their family.

Felimon operates a food stall from which he sells fish and squid balls, quail eggs and other street foods. He is applying for another 40,000 PHP loan through CCT to buy more ingredients for his fish balls and other dainties and sweet meats that he sells. He knows the more items displayed at the store, the greater the profits. These will definitely help him to cover the family’s daily needs and educational expenses for his children.

Felimon looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. He hopes to see his business grow and dreams of giving his family a good life and future.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients, of which Felimon is one, are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for his fish balls and other dainties and sweet meats that he sells.
